business.headline: Government plans new ATMs to dispense small currency notes: ReportWhile digital payments are growing rapidly, cash continues to play a key role in daily life for many Indians. Daily wage workers, street vendors, small shopkeepers and commuters often rely on cash for routine purchases and travel.

Budget 2026: Will senior citizens get higher tax exemption and pensions?Ahead of Budget 2026, senior citizens are seeking stronger healthcare support, higher pensions and meaningful tax relief. Experts say focused policy action is needed to build a dignified and affordable senior care ecosystem.

India-EU trade deal: Tariffs on European cars, medical items, wine to be cut Live UpdatesThe biggest headline is autos. India will gradually cut tariffs on European cars to 10%, a huge drop from an effective duty load that often reaches about 70% today.

Silver prices jump by nearly Rs 25,000: What's behind the sudden rally?Silver prices are enjoying a rally like never before. On Tuesday, the white metal suddenly jumped by about Rs 25,000, leaving investors wondering whether this is a short-term spike or the start of a bigger trend.

India-EU trade deal: Will European cars really get cheaper?For years imported cars from Europe have attracted some of the highest duties in the world. A fully built model faces taxes of about 70% to 110%. That is the single biggest reason a BMW, Audi or Mercedes costs so much more in India than it does in Europe.

Why the EU-India FTA won't be signed todayIndia and the European Union (EU) are set to announce the conclusion of negotiations on a long-awaited free trade agreement (FTA) on Tuesday. However, the trade deal, which marks a major milestone, would not be signed today. That is because the deal has to undergo legal vetting, translation and ratification. This is when the EU-India FTA might come into force.

India-EU FTA: Will Sensex, Nifty rally because of European Union trade deal?The deal aims to open up India's large and closely protected market to freer trade with the 27-nation European bloc, which is also India's biggest trading partner.

India-EU trade deal: What FTA may change for goods, services and your costsConsumers can expect cheaper European cars, more affordable electronics and smoother services access as India and the European Union prepare to officially announce the conclusion of negotiations on their long-awaited free trade deal.

Why Sensex, Nifty fell today despite India-EU trade deal announcement?Sensex fell more than 400 points in early trade, while the Nifty dropped close to 100 points. However, both indices recovered part of the losses and were trading higher by around 9:40 am. Despite this recovery, the overall mood on the Street remained cautious.
Sensex, Nifty open lower despite India-EU trade deal hopes; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 393.37 points to 81,144.33, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.65 points to 24,952.00 as of 9:30 am.

Gold, silver reach record highs. Check gold and silver rates in your cityGold futures jumped over 1.7% to hit a record high of Rs 159,820 per 10 grams. Silver futures saw an even sharper move, rising around 6% to touch a record high of Rs 354,780 per kg.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock market likely to open higher. Here's whyGift Nifty futures were trading at 25,187 at around 8:30 AM. This suggests that the Nifty 50 may open above its previous close of 25,048.65 recorded on Friday. Stock markets were closed on Monday due to the Republic Day holiday.

EU–India FTA: Will the mother of all trade deals be announced today?Senior EU leaders have described the proposed agreement as one of the biggest and most complex trade deals the bloc has ever attempted, with some calling it the "mother of all deals".

Live: We did it, EU chief tells PM Modi as 'mother of all trade deals' announcedIndia EU Trade Deal Live Updates: India and the European Union on Tuesday announced the conclusion of negotiations on a free trade agreement that has come to be called the 'mother of all deals Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India has concluded the biggest-ever trade agreement.

India, Russia trade on track for $100 billion by 2030 amid crude surge: AmbassadorIndia and Russia are confidently working towards a $100 billion bilateral trade target by 2030. Increased trade in national currencies and new agreements hint at stronger economic ties ahead.

Lower auto tariffs, wider market access: What the India-EU trade deal may look likeIndia-European Union trade negotiations have reached a decisive stage, with New Delhi offering major tariff cuts on European cars and both sides signalling readiness to seal a politically significant deal that could reshape trade, investment and supply chains.
India plans to cut EU car tariffs to 40% from 110% ahead of trade deal: ReportThe anticipated tariff cuts would substantially ease access to the Indian market for Volkswagen, Mercedes-Benz and BMW.

IndiGo cancels flights to Tbilisi, Tashkent, Baku till Jan 28 amid Iran tensionsIn view of the prevailing situation and after careful assessment, IndiGo said it was cancelling flights to and from Tbilisi (Georgia), Almaty (Kazakhstan), Tashkent (Uzbekistan) and Baku (Azerbaijan) on January 26, 27 and 28.

India, EU mega trade deal near finish line with phased tariff cuts: Maros SefcovicAutomobiles have long been one of the toughest chapters in the India–EU free trade negotiations. European carmakers have sought lower import duties and clearer rules to expand their footprint in India, while New Delhi has remained cautious, wary of exposing domestic manufacturers to sudden competition.

India set to become 3rd-largest economy, but why is per capita income still low?Every time India moves up the global GDP ranks, the per capita income question resurfaces. Looking at both together shows a truer picture than letting one overshadow the other.

entertainment.headline: Disha Patani, Shahid Kapoor add firepower to O'Romeo with Aashiqon Ki Colony song Aashiqon Ki Colony, the latest song from O'Romeo, features Shahid Kapoor and Disha Patani in a high-energy dance number. Composed by Vishal Bhardwaj with lyrics by Gulzar, the track combines seduction, rhythm and sharp choreography.

Akshay Kumar teases Karisma Kapoor over Bandra flats; she claims he owns Juhu Actor Akshay Kumar joked about Karisma Kapoor owning flats in every Bandra building. She responded by saying that Akshay owns the entire Juhu.

Ajith Kumar's Mankatha re-release hits Rs 13 crore, trails Ghilli, Padayappa Ajith Kumar's re-released action thriller Mankatha secures strong box office returns but remains behind Rajinikanth's Padayappa and Vijay's Ghilli among Tamil re-releases, while also ranking among the top South Indian re-releases.

Vadh 2 trailer: Neena Gupta, Sanjay Mishra lead a compelling mystery thriller The upcoming thriller Vadh 2, features Sanjay Mishra and Neena Gupta in pivotal roles. The film is a sequel to Vadh (2022).

Sarabhai v Sarabhai makers say Satish Shah's Padma Shri came too late The late actor Satish Shah was conferred the 2026 Padma Shri posthumously for his contributions to Indian entertainment. The honour prompted reactions from the creators of 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai' who noted the timing of the same.

Border 2 outguns Sky Force, Fighter at Republic Day box office; Pathaan unbeaten Republic Day box office 2026: Border 2 dominates the holiday business with Rs 193.48 crore nett in four days. Sunny Deol's film beats recent R-Day releases, second only to Pathaan.

May the universe give me the strength: KJo announces break from social media Filmmaker Karan Johar has announced a week-long digital detox, stepping away from social media to distance himself from the noise of the online world.

Who is Talwiinder Singh, Disha Patani's rumoured masked boyfriend? Talwiinder, an indie Punjabi music artist, has attracted attention not only for his viral tracks but also for his rumoured association with actor Disha Patani.

Director Lokesh Kanagaraj hits back at drug glorification claims in his films Director Lokesh Kanagaraj has responded to allegations that his films encourage drug culture. He talked about his off-screen efforts against drug abuse and clarified his stance on social responsibility.

Beckham family feud: Kangana Ranaut picks a side with 'real queen energy' Kangana Ranaut picked a side amid the ongoing Beckham family feud, sharing her support on social media. The dispute intensified after Brooklyn Beckham accused his parents of interfering in his marriage to Nicola Peltz.

Dhurandhar The Revenge gets 3 certified teasers, one rated U/A: Report Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar: The Revenge adopts a first-of-its-kind promotional strategy with three censored teasers. The sequel arrives March 19 after Dhurandhar's Rs 1,000 crore global run.

From Karan Patel to Prince Narula: Meet 50 confirmed contestants of The 50 JioHotstar's new reality show The 50 premieres on February 1 with 50 celebrity contestants from television, music and the digital space. The fan-powered format lets audiences back their favourites and win a share of the prize money.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan faces setback, court pauses order granting censor certificate The Madras High Court has set aside a single-judge order granting censor clearance to Jana Nayagan and sent the case back for a fresh hearing.

Sara Ali Khan and Orry's friendship reportedly hits a roadblock: How did it start? The public fallout between Sara Ali Khan and Orry began after a series of controversial comments on social media. The posts drew heavy criticism online and sparked fresh debate about limits and behaviour in influencer culture.

Randeep Hooda's wife Lin Laishram's baby shower blends tradition, fun and games Actors Lin Laishram and Randeep Hooda, who are expecting their first child, hosted an intimate baby shower celebration, and pictures from the event have surfaced online.

Bella Hadid, boyfriend Adan Banuelos split after dating for two years: Report Supermodel Bella Hadid and professional rodeo star Adan Banuelos have reportedly ended their relationship after over two years. Neither has publicly commented, but reports indicate the split occurred in January 2026.

Ranbir Kapoor shares big update on Animal Park shoot Ranbir Kapoor recently provided updates on his highly-anticipated film 'Animal Park', the sequel to the 2023 film 'Animal'. The actor indicated that production is scheduled to begin in 2027.

Singer Chinmayi counters Chiranjeevi's denial of casting couch in Telugu cinema Singer Chinmayi Sripaada has publicly reacted to veteran actor Chiranjeevi's recent comments dismissing the existence of casting couch practices in the Telugu industry. Sharing her experiences and those of other women, Chinmayi has highlighted ongoing issues of harassment and exploitation.

Border 2 box office Day 4: Big Republic Day boost for Sunny Deol starrer Sunny Deol's action-packed film Border 2 continued its blockbuster run on Monday as it saw a major boost during the Republic Day holiday. Strong audience response and festive footfalls kept the film buzzing at the box office.

general news.headline: Live: We did it, EU chief tells PM Modi as 'mother of all trade deals' announcedIndia EU Trade Deal Live Updates: India and the European Union on Tuesday announced the conclusion of the much-awaited free trade agreement, which has been labelled as the "mother of all deals". Prime Minister Narendra Modi, European Commission President Ursula Von Der Leyen, and European Council President António Luís Santos da Costa, made the announcement during a joint press briefing in New Delhi. During his address, PM Modi said that the India-EU cooperation will bring stability to an otherwise turbulent global order. During the briefing, the EU leaders praised India's hospitality and diversity at the Republic Day celebrations, where they were the chief guests.

India-EU trade deal: Tariffs on European cars, medical items, wine to be cut  Live UpdatesThe biggest headline is autos. India will gradually cut tariffs on European cars to 10%, a huge drop from an effective duty load that often reaches about 70% today.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan faces setback, court pauses order granting censor certificateThe Madras High Court has set aside a single-judge order granting censor clearance to Jana Nayagan and sent the case back for a fresh hearing.

India already has anti-discrimination laws, so why this new UGC rule?The UGC has introduced new regulations to enforce anti-caste discrimination measures in higher education institutions. However, experts and critics question the need for these rules given existing laws and raise concerns about enforcement and due process.

Why Daddy Trump won't like India-EU Mother of all DealsIndia-EU FTA: A continent Donald Trump has mocked and pressured over his Greenland ambition, signing a trade deal with a country he has sought to corner with sky-high tariffs, will no doubt be a sore sight. Will this nudge Trump to secure a trade with India?

India-EU cooperation can bring stability to a global order in turmoil: PM ModiMarking January 27 as a milestone, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India and the EU were working toward what he described as one of the largest free trade agreements in history, involving the bloc's 27 member states.

Deadly dispute: Bengaluru man deliberately crashes car to kill friend after fightThe dispute, which reportedly escalated after the two had been drinking, turned fatal when the victim tried to stop the vehicle by holding onto its door, with the driver allegedly crashing into a tree while driving rashly.

Why the EU-India FTA won't be signed todayIndia and the European Union (EU) are set to announce the conclusion of negotiations on a long-awaited free trade agreement (FTA) on Tuesday. However, the trade deal, which marks a major milestone, would not be signed today. That is because the deal has to undergo legal vetting, translation and ratification. This is when the EU-India FTA might come into force.
EU Chief shows up in Anamika Khanna after Republic Day bandhgalaIn a nod to Indian fashion, EU chief Ursula von der Leyen wore an Anamika Khanna bandhgala jacket for the 16th India-EU summit.

Ex-IAF chief explains why India fielded MiG-21 vs Pak F-16 during Balakot dogfightDuring the 2019 Balkot dogfight, Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman's MiG-21 Bison was shot down, leading many to wonder whether deploying the MiGs during the dogfight was a sound decision.

India helped Bangladesh weave a success story. It'll now fight it out in EuropeIndia didn't just help Bangladesh in its 1971 Liberation War but supported it throughout its development journey. India helped Bangladesh build the ready-made garments sector, which helped pull millions out of poverty. Some say India sacrificed its own textiles industry for that. Now, that very sector will see competition from Indian exports, especially in the European markets.

The quiet mental health cost of being an influencerHandcrafted ByOur Editors The Indian influencer marketing industry is valued at approximately Rs 3,375 crore in 2026, but what no one talks about is the toll behind, the burnout.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

India-EU trade deal: Will European cars really get cheaper?For years imported cars from Europe have attracted some of the highest duties in the world. A fully built model faces taxes of about 70% to 110%. That is the single biggest reason a BMW, Audi or Mercedes costs so much more in India than it does in Europe.

UGC 2026 regulation row Live: Students protest in Lucknow, Delhi HQ, PIL filed in Supreme CourtUGC Regulations Row Live Updates:Students and teachers across India are protesting UGC's new caste-based equity rules in colleges. The regulations, aimed at promoting fairness, have sparked nationwide debate and demonstrations.

Sunita Williams tried falooda in Kerala and loved it, of course. Watch videoSunita Williams, the celebrated astronaut, visited a popular falooda store in Kozhikode, and a video of her warm interaction and enjoyment of the dessert charmed locals and social media alike.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

UGC row: Your cheat sheet to controversy over new guidelinesThe University Grants Commission (UGC) has notified a new set of regulations aimed at addressing discrimination in higher education institutions across India.

Millennial parenting done right: Kids vibe with parents to Linkin Park in MumbaiSeveral parents attended Linkin Park's concert in Mumbai with their young children who didn't cry, throw tantrums or disrupt the crowd. Instead, they vibed along, sang the lyrics, and turned the concert into what many called "core memory" moments.

Sara Ali Khan and Orry's friendship reportedly hits a roadblock: How did it start?The public fallout between Sara Ali Khan and Orry began after a series of controversial comments on social media. The posts drew heavy criticism online and sparked fresh debate about limits and behaviour in influencer culture.

Iranian biker influencer shot dead for participating in anti-Khamenei protestsDiana Bahadori, 19, had 144,000 followers on Instagram and was popular for her grand reels showcasing her control of superbikes. She reportedly had taken part in ongoing protests in Iran in the nights preceding her death on January 9.

Meta can read your WhatsApp chats, lawsuit claims; Musk reacts: Story in 5 pointsA US lawsuit claims Meta can access WhatsApp messages despite end-to-end encryption promises. Meta has denied the allegations, while Elon Musk questioned WhatsApp's security. Here is the full story in 5 points.

Congress's dare to Zoho's Sridhar Vembu amid sparring over cow urine researchThe Congress mocked IIT Madras director V Kamakoti after he received Padma Shri for his past views on alleged medicinal values of cow urine. Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu defended the educator, slamming the political party for its "slavish colonial mindset".

sports.headline: Michael Schumacher no longer bedridden, shows rare progress 12 years after accident Twelve years after his devastating skiing accident, Formula One legend Michael Schumacher has shown rare signs of progress, with a Fox Sports report stating that he is no longer bed-bound.

T20 World Cup: Scotland confident on getting India visa for Pakistan-origin pacer Scotland are confident of securing Indian visas in time for the T20 World Cup despite late entry. Cricket Scotland expects Pakistan-origin pacer Safyaan Sharif and teammates to receive clearance before travel.

Australia's T20 World Cup winner Richardson retires from professional cricket Kane Richardson, a member of Australia's 2021 T20 World Cup-winning squad and one of the Big Bash League's most prolific bowlers, has announced his retirement from professional cricket after 17 seasons.

IND vs ZIM, U-19 live: Vaibhav Suryavanshi in action as Zimbabwe opt to bowl IND vs ZIM, U-19 World Cup live score: Zimbabwe have won the toss and opted to bowl first against India in Bulawayo. Vaibhav Suryavanshi will be in action shortly.

Is Shakib homecoming Bangladesh's eyewash after T20 World Cup axe? Ex-captain in splits Tamim Iqbal has warned Bangladesh against using Shakib Al Hasan as an eyewash after the T20 World Cup setback. The former captain said Shakib's return must be based on merit, not damage control.

Once an U19 World Cup winner with Virat Kohli, Ajitesh Argal now officiates in WPL Once an U19 World Cup winner alongside Virat Kohli, Ajitesh Argal's journey through Indian cricket has taken a quiet but compelling turn. In the ongoing season of the Women's Premier League (WPL), Argal has been seen not with the ball in hand but with an umpire's counter, officiating at the highest level of the women's game.

India should continue to back Sanju Samson: Rahane's advice for struggling opener Ajinkya Rahane has urged India to continue backing Sanju Samson despite his lean run in the T20I series. The former batter stressed belief, freedom and patience as key during the World Cup build-up.

MS Dhoni shares wisdom with youngsters at Jharkhand nets, begins IPL preparations MS Dhoni was spotted training with youngsters at the JSCA International Cricket Stadium in Ranchi. He also guided the emerging talent, sharing his experiences with them.

Former FIFA President joins World Cup boycott calls, urges fans to stay away from USA Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter has backed boycott calls, urging fans to avoid the USA during the 2026 World Cup. He cites security, civil rights, travel bans and immigration enforcement concerns surrounding tournament hosts now.

Australian Open: Dominant Sabalenka marmalises teenager Jovic to reach semis Aryna Sabalenka defeated 18-year-old Iva Jovic 6-3, 6-0 to reach the Australian Open semi-finals. She will next face either Coco Gauff or Elina Svitolina in the semi final.

Sorry folks, India are the team to beat and rest are just spectators in T20 World Cup India blew away New Zealand to secure another T20I series with a thumping win in Guwahati. With that the Indian team has sent the loudest message that the T20 World Cup 2026 is their title to lose.

ICC sidelined Bangladesh's legitimate security concerns: Ex Pakistan cricketerMohammad Yousuf has strongly criticised the ICC for removing Bangladesh from the T20 World Cup 2026 and replacing them with Scotland. He feels that the decision has raised concerns over governance and fairness within international cricket.

Sanju Samson paradox: Should India hold firm or roll the dice as T20 World Cup nearsAs the T20 World Cup 2026 approaches, India must decide whether to persist with Sanju Samson at the top or rethink their opening plans in search of form, clarity and stability.

After making surprise entry, Scotland announce T20 World Cup 2026 squadScotland have named a 15-man men's squad led by Richie Berrington, featuring George Munsey, Brandon McMullen and Safyaan Sharif, with travelling and non-travelling reserves added for depth.

Day 10 Live Updates: Zverev beats Tien, Sabalenka into semifinalsAustralian Open, Day 10 Live Updates: Alexander Zverev has booked his place in the semi-finals, but only after a gruelling battle against 20-year-old American Learner Tien, who impressed the world with his fighting spirit. Earlier, Aryna Sabalenka stormed into the final four with a dominant win over Iva Jovic. Up next, Carlos Alcaraz takes the court.

Scotland sympathises with Bangladesh after T20 World Cup sagaCricket Scotland's chief executive, Trudy Lindblade, expressed sympathy for Bangladesh following their withdrawal from the T20 World Cup 2026 due to security concerns in India. Scotland had replaced Bangladesh in Group C for the mega event.

IND vs NZ, New Zealand make notable squad changes to hit back after India's hammeringNew Zealand added Jimmy Neesham, Lockie Ferguson and Tim Seifert to their T20I squad in India, while Finn Allen will join for the final match, with India already leading the series 3-0.

ISL tipped to return on February 14, to kick-off with Mohun Bagan vs Kerala BlastersMohun Bagan Super Giant will open the ISL 2025-26 season against Kerala Blasters on February 14, while the Kolkata derby against East Bengal is scheduled for May 3, as per tentative fixtures released by the AIFF.

Richa's heroics in vain as Sciver-Brunt's special night keeps MI alive in playoffs raceNat Sciver-Brunt became the first player to score a century in the Women's Premier League. Her innings propelled Mumbai Indians to a commanding 50-run victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru, keeping their playoff hopes alive.

Linkin Park's Emily Armstrong flaunts Indian cricket jersey, powers electric showEmily Armstrong wore the Indian cricket jersey and lit up Linkin Park's long-awaited Bengaluru debut, as a 40,000-strong crowd witnessed a historic, high-octane show blending classic anthems with new-era energy.

Nat Sciver-Brunt lights up Vadodara with historic first-ever century in WPLWPL 2026, RCB vs MI: Nat Sciver-Brunt became the first batter to score a hundred in the history of the tournament Mumbai Indians locked horns with Royal Challengers Bengaluru on Monday in Vadodara.

Ranji Trophy: Padikkal named Karnataka captain, KL Rahul returns for Punjab clashDevdutt Padikkal has replaced Mayank Agarwal as Karnataka's captain for their final league-stage Ranji Trophy match against Punjab.

Bangladesh's cricket crisis deepens with U19 World Cup exit after senior's T20 WC snubBangladesh U19 have been knocked out of the U19 World Cup after England beat them by seven wickets in the Super Sixes match on Monday in Bulawayo. Earlier, the senior men's team was left out of the T20 World Cup with Scotland replacing them.

Shai Hope to lead as West Indies name strong squad for T20 World CupThe West Indies have named a strong 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026, with the two-time champions set to be led by Shai Hope at the ICC tournament.

Ishan Kishan's audacious intent receives big praise from R Ashwin: Different breedIND vs NZ: Ravichandran Ashwin praised Ishan Kishan's fearless batting after his rapid 28 off 13 balls against New Zealand, saying the left-hander's audacity and confidence showed a different breed of cricketer.

RCB vs MI Highlights: Richa's fireworks in vain as Mumbai Indians win by 15 runsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs Mumbai Indians (MI), WPL 2026 Highlights: Vadodara witnessed a high-scoring thriller as Mumbai Indians stay in contention for a spot in the play-offs with a 15-run win over the Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Sabalenka, Alcaraz headline star-studded quarterfinal lineupAustralian Open: Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek, Carlos Alcaraz, Jannik Sinner and several other top contenders will be chasing places in the semifinals when they take the court in their respective quarterfinal matches.

India wanted Bangladesh in T20 World Cup but Pakistan misled them: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla accused Pakistan of instigating Bangladesh after it refused to play T20 World Cup 2026 matches in India, leading to ICC rejecting venue changes and Scotland replacing Bangladesh.

Pakistan delay final call on T20 World Cup participation after PCB chief meets Pak PMThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has delayed a final decision on the country's participation in the T20 World Cup after chairman Mohsin Naqvi met Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif.

Tilak Varma is a big-match player, knock vs Pakistan was unbelievable: Rohit SharmaTilak Varma has firmly established himself as a big-match player, delivering consistent performances for Mumbai Indians and India, including a match-winning 69* in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan.

Don Bradman's Australia Baggy Green fetches whopping 460,000 dollars in auctionSir Donald Bradman's rare Baggy Green cap from the 1947–48 season sold for a record 460,000 dollars at auction, underscoring the enduring legacy and unmatched cultural value of cricket's greatest icon.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
